Troy weight is a system of units of mass customarily used for precious metals and 
gemstones. There are 12 troy ounces per troy pound, (373.24 g) rather than the 
16 ounces per pound (453.59 g) found in the more common avoirdupois system. 
The troy ounce is 480 grains, compared with the avoirdupois ounce, which is .... 
the tower pound of 5400 grains, but a later pound of 5760 grains displaced it.
